chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Scott R. Tucker
parties.address: 214 S 3rd Street Unit 1, Black River Falls, WI 54615

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as Conditions of Probation in this case.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, illegal or controlled substances, and is not allowed entry into places that primarily sell alcohol.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
The defendant shall attend counseling, programs or treatment as directed by the agent, and shall make all counseling records available to the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Defendant has 63 days credit to be applied to this 4 month jail sentence.

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant's Attorney Christine Kuczynski appeared.  Defense agrees to plea hearing by video.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 11:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Kim from DA's office, Attorney Christine Kuczynski, Judge Wolf's office, & SS from Clerk of Court present. Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 10:30 am. Judge Wolf will appear by video.

Origina Cash l Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.  Bond was amended to a signature bond

Judge Wolf appeared by video from Wood County. Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant's Attorney Christine Kuczynski appeared.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Defendant asking for a signature bond so he can go into a in house treatment center - granted to a $5000 signature bond, same conditions plus needs to follow all ATR rules

The defendant shall have no contact with D.M of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to be on or about the premises of 1910 Johnson Street, Neillsville WI.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.   Defendant is to follow all treatment procedures included in the Alternative To Revocation. 
AMENDED 04/19/2016 to a signature bond.
